bill.summary: 3/13/2001--Passed House amended. Condemns, in the strongest possible terms, the atrocities that occurred on March 5, 2001, at Santana High School in Santee, California, when a gunman opened fire, killing two students and wounding 13 others. Offers the condolences of Congress to the families, friends, and loved ones of those killed in the shooting.Expresses hope for the rapid and complete recovery of those wounded in the shooting.Applauds the hard work and dedication exhibited by local and State law enforcement officials and by others who offered support and assistance.Commends the rapid response by the faculty and staff of Santana High School in evacuating its students to safety in an efficient and effective manner.Encourages: (1) communities to implement a wide range of violence prevention services for the Nation's youth; and (2) the people of the United States to engage in a national dialogue on preventing school violence.
